original_title: Cuban Ambassador agrees to share expertise with Sri Lanka regarding mosquito control
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st) – The Cuban Ambassador to Sri Lanka Andres Marcelo Gonzalez Garrido has expressed his agreement to share Cuban expertise in mosquito control activities with the health authorities of Sri Lanka, at a meeting with Prime Minister Dinesh Gunawardena at Temple Trees.
The Prime Minister thanked Cuba for the consistent support extended to Sri Lanka at the United Nations and other international forums.
He also referred to the assistance given to Sri Lanka to combat Dengue epidemic and stressed the need for continuous cooperation in the field of medicine.
The Ambassador agreed to share Cuban expertise in mosquito eradication with Sri Lankan health authorities.
